Description: Rim fragment of East Greek pottery bowl; top of lip glazed; outside, frieze of verticals above a band and a frieze including a floral motif with spiral; all fired red-brown.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 214, no. 40)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 105, pl. XXXIII, no. 316.1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.758)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4804 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
